intro: Stenotaenia macrocarpa subsp. macrocarpa, commonly known as the large-fruited sedge, is a perennial herb native to parts of Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its robust, grass-like foliage and produces large, elongated, cylindrical inflorescences. The plant typically grows in wetland or riparian habitats, thriving in moist, well-drained soils. Its flowers are small and clustered, with three stamens and a three-lobed pistil. The subspecies is distinguished by its relatively large, showy fruits compared to other members of the genus.
